reviews.review: Of Avengers Infinity War, I would say, the tragedy of Red Skull epitomizes the barren landscape of creativity that Marvel has become since being consumed by the corporate maw of Disney.... at least the directors respected the characters especially Thor in contrast to the comic farce of Thor Ragnarok!
AMAZING! Russo brothers know how to make a film.

Such a great flick - so many years in the making and it was worth it, legit got emotional at the end. Some pacing issues to be sure but thatâ€™s overshadowed by the sheer number of characters they were able to stuff into this movie. Would watch again

This is my second time seeing the film and it just might be my favorite of the "Avengers" ensemble movies thus far. It still has all of the hilarious, side-splitting banter that's been such a mainstay of the other movies, however it also goes places that movies of this nature hardly ever go for fear of alienating mainstream audiences. There are some scenes that can catch people off guard the first time around and really challenge what they come to expect from big budget superhero flicks in general. I will say that Thanos is unequivocally the greatest villain that the MCU has ever come up with and he might be up there with some of the classic villains of cinematic history like Darth Vader, Voldemort and Sauron. In my opinion this does for the Marvel films what "The Last Jedi" does for the Star Wars films as we find our heroes at their lowest ebb, which makes us curious as to how they will forge on in their respective sequels. Definitely something to see multiple times for sure.
If anyone in thinking about seeing this so called movie DONT DONT DONT !!! Biggest load of garbage I have ever seen. GIVE ME MY MORE THAN 2 HOURS BACK.

While some might find the ending of this journey sad, I find it breathtaking. I had heard the hype. Seen the trailers. Seen all the predecessors and characters that accumulated to create this movie. But I'm blown away. It not only delivered but had a lesson. The good guys don't always win. Lives are lost. Loved ones lost. Futures lost. That's a part of life and this movie captures it with a sometimes funny, sometimes sad story of of good versus evil.
Simply Amazing. As a lifelong Marcel comics fan I couldn't have asked for much more. This movie is cinematic perfection.
